instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F: What is PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F? PP5V_S0_ALSCAM is a power rail for the webcam and the ambient light sensor..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no picture
threads.message:
I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no picture. I found liquid damage on a view areas of the logicboard and on the board of the display. The flex-connector on the display-board (TConn) and the flexcable was damaged/scorched on the left and right side. I changed the connector and the flex. The connector on the logicboard have no damage.

The liquid spills on the logicboard was not very badly - i cleaned it all. These are the areas ...
Along the outer edge under L7221, <CHIP>U7220</CHIP>, QA340, QA650.
Under <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> the caps <CAPACITOR>C7818</CAPACITOR> to <CAPACITOR>C7846</CAPACITOR>.
<CAPACITOR>C7254</CAPACITOR>, <CHIP>U7370</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R7370</RESISTOR>.

Here are my measurements ...
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.35v
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>LCD_MUX_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.32v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 5.13v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F</SIGNAL> = 5.13
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 3.36v
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.35V

Is this a display issue? Or could <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> be the problem? I have not yet changed <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>.
Thanks for any help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no picture
threads.message:
Liquid signs on CPU and GPU power supplies, not good at all.

You've said no picture.
What about USB activity and external video?
Do you get CPU/GPU voltages?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no picture
threads.message:
The machine is running over ext. HDMI
Itâ€˜s only no picture on the int. display

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no picture
threads.message: If the LCD connector on the screen was liquid damaged, then <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> is most likely dead. Replace <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> and see if that fixes it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no picture
threads.message: If you have external video, then should be a problem with Analog MUX (<CHIP>U9850</CHIP>).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no picture
threads.message:
Changing <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> solved the issue - thanks.
Now only the backlight is missing - i try to fix this next.
